0.NAME: Shun Akiyama
0.TITLE: Sky Finance Owner
0.EXPLANATION: Owner of a Kamurocho-based loan company.

1.EXPLANATION: Owner of Sky Finance, a moneylender in Kamurocho. Known as the "Lifeline of Kamurocho," Akiyama loans money even to those who have been turned down by other loan sharks. Prospective clients must pass a special test to receive a loan.

2.EXPLANATION: Owner of Sky Finance, a moneylender in Kamurocho. Known as the "Lifeline of Kamurocho," Akiyama loans money even to those who have been turned down by other loan sharks. Prospective clients must pass a special test to receive a loan. After becoming involved in a fight between Kanemura Enterprises and the Ueno Seiwa Clan at Club Elnard, he witnesses the murder of Ihara by Arai and is arrested by the police for questioning. Though cleared of any wrong-doing, Akiyama draws the attention of Sugiuchi.

23.NAME: Hana
23.TITLE: Sky Finance Employee
23.EXPLANATION: Akiyama's personal assistant and office manager at Sky Finance. A reliable employee who takes care of things at the office for her laid-back and disorganized boss. Loves the Deluxe Kalbi Bento from Kanrai. Witnesses Arai's murder of Ihara. After Akiyama is arrested, she rushes to the police station to vouch for his innocence.

Heads to Club Elnard to diffuse the disturbance caused by the Ueno Seiwa Clan members but is shot by Ihara instead and sustains injuries.

46.EXPLANATION: Murdered Ihara of the Ueno Seiwa Clan as a result of the disturbance at Club Elnard and remained in hiding. In reality, the disturbance was part of a plot orchestrated by Katsuragi and Shibata, in which he was an accomplice. Killed his protector, Shibata, after he became inconvenient to Katsuragi. All of this was part of Munakata's plan to provoke a war between the Ueno Seiwa and Tojo Clans in order to consolidate the yakuza world. His position as captain of the Tojo Clan is assured by dealings between Munakata and Daigo.

47.EXPLANATION: Murdered Ihara of the Ueno Seiwa Clan as a result of the disturbance at Club Elnard and remained in hiding. In reality, everything was carried out under Munakata's orders to provoke a war between the Ueno Seiwa and Tojo Clans in order to consolidate the yakuza world. Sends Kido to Katsuragi to steal the top secret file in Kiryu's possession. Betrays Kido after obtaining the file in exchange for Saejima's safety and Kido's 100 billion yen. But fails to take Kido's life. Ordered by Munakata to use the kids at Morning Glory as leverage to retrieve the money, Arai follows his principles and shoots Munakata.

48.EXPLANATION: Murdered Ihara of the Ueno Seiwa Clan as a result of the disturbance at Club Elnard and remained in hiding. Arai's true identity was a undercover detective planted by Munakata to consolidate and control the yakuza world. Ordered by Munakata to use the kids at Morning Glory as leverage to retrieve 100 billion yen, Arai follows his principles and shoots Munakata. Sensing the possibility of Kido taking orders from Daigo, Arai spares Kido's life to confirm his suspicions. Battles Akiyama to put an end to the events he set in motion.

49.EXPLANATION: Murdered Ihara of the Ueno Seiwa Clan as a result of the disturbance at Club Elnard and remained in hiding. 121.NAME: Yoshiharu Ueno
121.TITLE: Ueno Seiwa Clan Chairman
121.EXPLANATION: Chairman of the Tojo Clan's former enemy, the Ueno Seiwa Clan. Attacked by Saejima in a ramen shop 25 years ago on the day of his release from prison. Although 18 of his men were killed, he escaped death and accepted a 50-50 peace with the second chairman of the Tojo Clan. However, as the clans greatly differed in scale, the Ueno Seiwa Clan essentially became a subsidiary of the Tojo Clan, and continues to pay protection money to them. Katsuragi, who shielded Ueno during the attack, was promoted to captain and is now in charge of the clan due to Ueno's old age.

Returns to Kamurocho with Yasuko, who is looking for Saejima, but both she and Saejima are abducted by Katsuragi. Attempts to trade the secret file for Yasuko's safety, but she dies protecting Saejima and the file is stolen by Arai. Clashes with Daigo, who chose to cause mayhem to protect the clan, on the roof of Millennium Tower. Feels responsible for Daigo's burden and defeats him.

192.EXPLANATION: Former fourth chairman of the Tojo Clan and legendary yakuza known as the Dragon of Dojima for the dragon tattoo on his back. Now runs Morning Glory Orphanage in Okinawa. Currently enjoying a stroll through the city.

Reprimanded by his boss, Hisai, when a complaint comes in about him taking money from civilians through mahjong. Currently tracking down the snitch who ratted him out.

Learns from Tanimura that Katsuragi of the Ueno Seiwa Clan orchestrated the string of Shibata Clan murders, and that someone within the force is cooperating with him. Sets a trap at Mishima's location to expose Sugiuchi's guilt.

249.EXPLANATION: Chief of the Kamurocho Police Criminal Investigations Division 1. Demoted out of the division due to his rash actions during the missing 10 billion yen incident, but reinstated the following year after the war with the Omi Alliance.

After being nearly killed by someone, he was rescued by Majima, and has since resided in Purgatory. 261.EXPLANATION: A girl working as a waitress at Homeland. Adores Tanimura as if he were her real brother. Hears all about Tanimura's work while having tea with Tanimura's boss, Hisai.

262.EXPLANATION: A girl working as a waitress at Homeland. Adores Tanimura as if he were her real brother. Nearly killed when she and Zhao are taken hostage by Hisai, who had just silenced Sugiuchi. Saved when Hisai cannot cope with his guilt and takes his own life. Believed to be dead by Munakata and his men.

263.EXPLANATION: A girl working as a waitress at Homeland. Adores Tanimura as if he were her real brother.

264.NAME: Makoto Date
264.TITLE: Keihin News Political Reporter
264.EXPLANATION: A former detective of Organized Crime Division 4 who became a newspaper reporter after the missing 10 billion yen incident. Has a close relationship with the proprietress of New Serena and is running the bar while she's away at home. Informs Kiryu that Saejima has already gone to see Majima.

265.EXPLANATION: A former detective of Organized Crime Division 4 who became a newspaper reporter after the missing 10 billion yen incident. Has a close relationship with the proprietress of New Serena and is running the bar while she's away at home. Keeps an eye on Lily while Kiryu goes to meet Majima, but she sneaks out by mixing sleeping pills into his drink.

266.EXPLANATION: A former detective of Organized Crime Division 4 who became a newspaper reporter after the missing 10 billion yen incident. Has a close relationship with the proprietress of New Serena and is running the bar while she's away at home. Astounded to discover that recent events are connected to the missing 10 billion yen incident that he had investigated as a detective.

267.EXPLANATION: A former detective of Organized Crime Division 4 who became a newspaper reporter after the missing 10 billion yen incident. Has a close relationship with the proprietress of New Serena and is running the bar while she's away at home. Astounded to discover that recent events are connected to the missing 10 billion yen incident that he had investigated as a detective. As Kiryu and the others go to settle the score after Lily's death, irritated at being able to do nothing but provide support.
